text: Now a song by Sia, and that’s it from San Francisco. No new laptops—in fact, no mention of Macs. But the iPhone 7 is sweet! #AppleEvent

text: Those wireless AirPods will be $160 (gulp). Late October. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 7 pricing: same as before. $650 and up, but double the storage (32, 128, 256 gb). 7 Plus: $770, same configs. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: Correction (sorry): iPhone 7 gets 2 hours more battery life than iPhone 6s. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 7 Plus battery: 2 hours a day longer than iPhone 6s. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 7: New processor has 4 cores. Two are for low-intensity calculations to save battery power. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: My guess: the wireless AirPods won’t stay in some ears. Fortunately, 2 new Beats earbuds have ear hooks for people like me. #appleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: The wireless AirPods come with a charging case that’s also a battery, for 24 hours of music. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: New wireless Apple AirPods. 5 hours music per charge. Charging case. IR sensors detect when in ears. Tap for Siri. Noise cancel. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: Phil Schiller explains killing the headphone jack: That old connector took up HUGE space inside. And wireless is the new thing. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 7: Stereo spkers (first on iPhone), 2x the volume. Earbuds connect to Lightning jack. Headphone adapter included in box. #appleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 7 Plus: New Portrait mode adds lovely soft-focus background (bokeh, or “depth effect”). #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: Correction (sorry): iPhone 7 optical zoom up to 2x, digital up to 10X. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 7: Optical zoom up to 5X, additional digital zoom to 10X. First non-thick phone with true zoom. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 7 Plus: Two 12-megapixel cameras. One for wide, one for telephoto—they combine for OPTICAL ZOOM ON SMARTPHONE. Boom. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 7 camera: Optical stabilization. f1.8 lens. 4-color flash, 50% brighter, face+body recognition. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 7: The new Home button vibrates as feedback. The body is water resistant (finally). Oh—and no headphone jack. :) #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: More iPhone 7 details: Comes in shiny black, matte black, gold, silver, rose gold. Home button customizable+force-sensitive. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 7 unveiled: Dual lenses (big bump on the back), gorgeous SHINY aluminum body. No headphone jack. #AppleEvent

author: David Pogue

author: David Pogue
text: (I gotta give a talk now… for more on Apple’s #WWDC updates as they happen, open our Yahoo Tech liveblog! https://t.co/435YBTnQvh )

author: David Pogue
text: More in iOS 10 photos: Object recognition, too. View photos on a map. Auto-grouped by trips, time periods (“last weekend”), topics, people.

author: David Pogue
text: More iOS 10: Smarter QuickType suggestions from context and even other apps. Photos now has facial recognition; groups shots by person.

author: David Pogue
text: New in iOS 10: Lift phone to wake it. The Control Center has 3 pages. Siri opened up to developers, so it can control other apps. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: Siri on the Mac: “What new movies are playing Friday?” “Send a message to my wife.” “Tell me a joke.” etc. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: Siri is finally on the Mac! “Show the files I worked on last week,” “Play jazz,” “Search the web for…”, etc. Drag or pin the results.

author: David Pogue
text: macOS Sierra: Tabbed windows in ALL apps. Picture-In-Picture (inset playback window) for videos you’re watching. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: macOS Sierra: An app to optimize storage. Deletes cache files, temp files, etc. Apple Pay button on Web sites—on iOS, pay with fingerprint.

author: David Pogue
text: macOS this fall: Whatever icons you leave on your Mac desktop are also on the desktop of other Macs and even iPhone (via iCloud syncing).

author: David Pogue
text: macOS Sierra this fall: Auto Unlock: Your Apple Watch unlocks the Mac without a password. Also, universal clipboard (iPhone<->Mac). #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: Apple is renaming OS X. New name: macOS. (Kind of like the old name, no?) #WWDC)

author: David Pogue
text: Apple TV updates: An iPhone remote-control app. Siri searches YouTube and sports events now. And SINGLE SIGN-ON for all video services!

author: David Pogue
text: More new Apple Watch features: Fitness tracking for wheelchair users. A deep-breathing relaxation app. Reply to texts with finger writing.

author: David Pogue
text: New Apple Watch feature: Hold in the side button to call to 911 (after a 3-second warning). Notifies your contacts that you’re in trouble.

author: David Pogue
text: And now, a few WWDC updates: First, Apple has greatly improved its Watch OS—including making the side button call up frequent apps. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: Here's our complete writeup on the new iPad Pro: Apple Introduces Enormous iPad Pro with Apple Pencil StylusApple'... http://t.co/Af8xKvPp5P

author: David Pogue
text: Apple announces iPhone Upgrade Program in Apple stores: Pay $32/month, get a new iPhone to use every year. With AppleCare+ insurance.

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 6s prices: $200, $300, $400 (for 16, 64, and 128gb, with contract). Plus models $100 more. Same as before.

author: David Pogue
text: The "live photo" videos get taken automatically every time you snap a shot. (Captures 1.5 sec before and after the moment you snap.) Wild.

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 6s: "Live photos": Photos with four-second videos that play when you hard-press. With sound. Weird.

author: David Pogue
text: When you're taking a selfie, the iPhone 6s flashes the screen in an appropriate color to make your skin tones look good. #appleevent

author: David Pogue
text: The iPhone 6s can capture 4K videos....but can't play them back. (The screen doesn't have 8 million pixels.)

author: David Pogue
text: 63 megapixel panoramas!

author: David Pogue
text: More in the iPhone 6s: fingerprint recognition 2x faster. New 12 megapixel camera--and more importantly, tech to make them BETTER pixels.

author: David Pogue
text: RT @Bruce_Watson_: @Pogue You know a product has peaked when it's offered in colors.

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 6s home-screen icons have shortcut menus, too. Phone app: speed-dial names. Camera: options like Selfie. Map: "Directions home."

author: David Pogue
text: New iPhone touch screen: Press lightly for a preview (of a message, photo, map, link etc.). Keep finger down to open it. #appleevent

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 6s's "even stronger glass screen" offers "3D touch" (pressure sensitivity). Press harder for a shortcut menu.

author: David Pogue
text: The new iPhones look the same as before, but there’s a rose gold option (pinkish), and the innards are different. http://t.co/QnfEKqHjXc

author: David Pogue
text: ( I mean, they look exactly the same as last year's models.)

author: David Pogue
text: OK, here we go. Tim Cook revealing the iPhone 6s and 6s Plus. Whoa--they look--EXACTLY THE SAME! #appleevent

author: David Pogue
text: OK, here we go. Tim Cook revealing the iPhone 6s and 6s Plus. Whoa--they look--EXACTLY THE SAME!

author: David Pogue
text: AppleTV remote uses Bluetooth (don't have to point it at the TV anymore), 3 months on a charge, recharges via Lightning jack. $150 and $200.

author: David Pogue
text: Apple TV: Watch 2 baseball games simultaneously. (But can my kid watch a movie at the same time, too?)

author: David Pogue
text: So, Apple TV = games, shopping, Siri, apps? Has a trackpad? Apple clearly has MUCH bigger ambitions for it now. It's a laptop for your TV!

author: David Pogue
text: Whoa. The Apple TV remote apparently has an accelerometer, too, so you can swing it like a Wii remote for playing baseball games and stuff.

author: David Pogue
text: You can ask Apple TV questions that Siri does on the phone--about sports, weather, music, etc. Answers appear in a panel below your movie.

author: David Pogue
text: "Show me that 'Modern Family' episode with Edward Norton." Apple TV pulls it up. Nice. #appleevent

author: David Pogue
text: Apple TV searches all the different online video stores with a single Siri query. That's rather awesome. #appleevent http://t.co/70detuWi8P

author: David Pogue
text: "Show me family movies." "Just the new ones." "Anything with Jason Bateman." Apple TV comes w a voice-activated (Siri) remote. #appleevent

author: David Pogue
text: The Apple TV is getting an app store. Does that mean it will finally have Amazon Video?

author: David Pogue
text: RT @vgirotto: @Pogue It just seems like they didn't learn from the Surface: a lot of the complaints with it were "lapability", viewing angl…

author: David Pogue
text: Correction! iPad Pro $800, $950, and $1080 for 32gb, 128, and 128+cellular. And the Pencil is $100.

author: David Pogue
text: If you kind of squint, iPad Pro + keyboard cover = Microsoft Surface 3. Apple's take on the hybrid laptop, in other words. #appleevent

author: David Pogue
text: Keyboard cover + stylus aren't new ideas, but it seems clear that Apple has Apple-ized them--improved the a lot. Gonna be a hit. #appleevent

author: David Pogue
text: Apple inviting to the stage a VP from MICROSOFT. Early snowfall report in Hell!

author: David Pogue
text: Also, a new stylus: Apple Pencil. Measures location, force, and tilt of the pen. Recharges from the iPad's Lightning jack. Cool. #appleevent

author: David Pogue
text: The iPad Pro can be fitted with a new, magnetic iPad screen cover with physical keys. (*cough* Microsoft Surface idea *cough*) #appleevent

author: David Pogue
text: iPad Pro has 5.6 million pixels—more pixels than on the MacBook Pro with Retina screen. (I’d hate to be the guy who had to count them.)

author: David Pogue
text: Apple just unveiled the iPad Pro: Like the iPad, but bigger. 12.9” diagonal. Same width as the HEIGHT of the existing iPad. 1.8x faster.

author: David Pogue
text: Tim Cook showing off the new iPad Pro…

author: David Pogue
text: New Watches, now in silver aluminum and rose gold, and a stainless-steel "Product RED" model (red band). Nothing available in uranium yet.

author: David Pogue
text: Apple now unveiling a new line of Watches co-designed with Hermes, featuring very stylish leather bands, for very rich people.

author: David Pogue
text: Live demo of AirStrip, an Apple Watch app that shows output from medical devices. A mom can LISTEN to her baby's heartbeat via the watch.

author: David Pogue
text: Numbers Apple has revealed about the Watch: number of apps (10,000); customer satisfaction (97%). Not revealed: how many sold.

author: David Pogue
text: Tim Cook showing email from Dennis H: "I have lost 30 pounds with the Apple watch." (By taking off your Samsung Gear?)

author: David Pogue
text: Apple Music seems to be sort of Spotify+iTunes+Ping, all mashed together in a fairly confusing mobile app…still waiting for the price. #WWDC

text: (Everyone’s asking why I’m using the term “catch-up” a lot—it’s to stifle the 500 tweets that would say “Android’s already had that!”) #WWDC

author: David Pogue

author: David Pogue

author: David Pogue
text: Sorry, not winding down yet. Tim Cook saying 100 billion apps downloaded from App Store, $30 billion paid to developers. #WWDC.

author: David Pogue
text: Winding down Apple’s keynote. Swift (dev. toolkit) will be open source. Better CarPlay and HomeKit and ResearchKit. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: iOS9: 1 hour longer battery life on iPhone. And if necessary, a low-power battery-saver mode for 3 MORE hours (more catch-up!). #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: More Apple catch-up: The iPad will have split-screen multitasking—either 50/50 or a second app in a side panel. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: In iOS 9, iPad’s word-suggestion bar gains buttons for cut, copy, paste, format. Also, 2 fingers on the keyboard acts as a trackpad. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: Whoa. iOS News app will give you 30 free NY Times stories a day, free. 17 Condé Nast magazines. Little local pubs can play, too. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: The iOS 9 News app looks sharp. Has animations, in-line videos—and it tailors its story suggestions according to your reading habits. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: Apple’s showing a new iOS 9 app called News—seems to be Apple’s take on Flipboard. You pick the sites whose stories you want to get. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: Yay that Apple added transit info to Maps (for 10 US cities). Now, maybe fix its DATABASE so it doesn’t give terrible directions!? #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: More iOS 9 news: Notes app gains formatting, checklists, links, photos, & sketches with your finger. Also, Maps gets public-transit options.

author: David Pogue
text: Apple Pay gets an expansion. More banks, more stores, more countries. Also loyalty and store cards. Also knows what store you’re in. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: Apple is now touting how (unlike Google) Apple doesn’t harvest your data, share it, or sell it. #WWDC http://t.co/lDqGynpwmQ

author: David Pogue
text: Siri in iOS 9 is way smarter about context. Say “Show me my photos from last June’s trip to Vegas”—and it does… #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: iOS 9 will anticipate. Plays audio book when you get in car; adds email invites to calendar; tries to ID unknown incoming calls. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: Now they’re unveiling iOS 9. Siri will be 40% faster, knows when you’re in your car, understands more complex commands. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: There’ll be a public beta of OS X El Capitan in July; finished version free to all in the fall. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: @maggiezhangx @Forbes I can’t respond to you privately unless you’re following me. :)

author: David Pogue
text: New OS X also has a split-screen mode, like Windows 8 (full-screen mode, 2 apps). #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: Key feature of new OS X version: When some browser tab is playing music and you can’t find it, there’s a Mute All button. #WWDC

author: David Pogue
text: This fall’s version of OS X will be called El Capitan.

text: RT @tonydehnke: If you buy the 10k gold Apple Watch, in 12 months Apple Watch 2 comes - can they swap the guts, or is it a $10k paperweight?

author: David Pogue
text: Anyone else find the naming of the Apple Watches weird? There’s the Watch Sport ($350), the Watch ($550), and the Watch Edition ($10,000)…

author: David Pogue
text: Given that you need an iPhone to use the Watch, I'm still not sure how mega a hit the Watch will be. But it's AWFULLy attractive.

author: David Pogue
text: You can preorder a Watch on April 10, and get it on April 24. In between, you'll have to pay your taxes.

author: David Pogue
text: The 18K gold watch priced "from" $10,000. The larger size is $50 more. :)

author: David Pogue
text: Sport watch (aluminum): $350. Stainless Steel (silver or black):  $550 and up, depending on band. The larger size is always $50 more.

author: David Pogue
text: You can get the Apple Watch, Sport model, either in aluminum alloy or, as Jony Ive pronounces it, "al-yoo-MINNY-um" alloy (extra charge).

author: David Pogue
text: Apple Watch: 18 hour battery. Recharge every night. Well, at least it's a magnetic charger that just snaps on. http://t.co/4vxZKlDad9

author: David Pogue
text: See a live video feed of your garage door on the Watch. Head exploding. http://t.co/yxD4HNxIOt

author: David Pogue
text: The Shazam app on the Apple Watch will show the lyrics as they're being sung. OK, that's it. I'm buying one. #THEFUTURE

author: David Pogue
text: You can scan your Apple Watch screen at the TSA security desk--right before you take it off to pass through the X-ray!

author: David Pogue
text: It's interesting: 2 sizes of Watch x 3 different metals x 9 different bands...Quite a departure from the usual Apple "one model suits all."

author: David Pogue
text: You can talk to Siri via the Watch either by holding in the side button (crown), or by saying "Hey Siri," hands free.

author: David Pogue
text: Apple Watch also has Apple Pay, Siri, notifications, control music playback, photos. Track sports, Facebook, news. And cleans your gutters.

author: David Pogue
text: Christy Turlington wore the Watch in a half-marathon in Africa. She must have the solid-gold one (Internet price rumor: $10,000).

author: David Pogue
text: Big emphasis on fitness on the Watch. Tracks you, coaches you, summarizes you. http://t.co/VTMye2Ra0I

author: David Pogue
text: You can send sketches, tap patterns, & your heartbeat to someone else with an Apple Watch. (In my book, 3 taps will equal "Can we go now?")

author: David Pogue
text: Whoa... built-in speaker/mike: you can take calls on the Watch. Wasn't the Samsung Gear widely mocked for that idea?

author: David Pogue
text: Swipe up from the bottom of the Watch to see weather, calendar, music playback. That's roughly consistent with the up-swipe on the iPhone.

author: David Pogue
text: Tim Cook now showing the different available watch faces on the Watch. (Jony Ive said that round screens are ridiculous for smartwatches.)

author: David Pogue
text: The New Yorker just ran a 453-page article about Jony Ive. He's a watch nut. He's got a lot riding on this here watch.

author: David Pogue
text: New MacBook ships April 10, $1300. Does not replace other models.

author: David Pogue
text: Clarifying my clarification: ONE jack for power/video/data—PLUS an audio jack (headphone etc.).

author: David Pogue
text: OK, to clarify: the new Mac has ONE jack. It’s power AND usb AND video out. Hm.

author: David Pogue
text: How long before we hear the first story of someone bending the new 1/2-inch-thick MacBook by sitting on it? http://t.co/gzq7TIUV6c

author: David Pogue
text: The MacBook will be available in silver, gray, or gold--and a free carrying case for all the adapters and USB port multipliers you'll need!

author: David Pogue
text: Oops, sorry--there is ONE port on there--USB C. A new type.

author: David Pogue
text: Almost the entire MacBook guts is battery. http://t.co/J3Sranf51K

author: David Pogue
text: This new MacBook is fanless and crazy, crazy small. It's clearly the love child of a MacBook Air and an iPad.

author: David Pogue
text: The new trackpad is pressure-sensitive. Harder clicks produce different effects--I.e., fast-forward a video faster the harder you press.

author: David Pogue
text: The new MacBook trackpad clicks equally easily anywhere (not just near the bottom)--and you can adjust how hard or soft it is. Very cool.

author: David Pogue
text: The new MacBook (they haven't said its name yet) has much improved keyboard, pixel illumination, trackpad...and, what...$5000?

author: David Pogue
text: I'm crazy about the new hyper-thin MacBook--but how did they do it? Are they going to tell us it comes with an external battery?

author: David Pogue
text: The new MacBook: 2 pounds, 1/2 inch thick, and you can fold it into an airplane.

author: David Pogue
text: Whoa... Apple's new laptop. Crazy thin slab of aluminum. You could remove a splinter with this thing.

author: David Pogue
text: You’ll opt in to all these new Apple disease apps—and Apple DOES NOT see your data. Only researchers.

author: David Pogue
text: New apps for Parkinson's, diabetes, asthma, heart health, breast cancer--this could be HUGE. No evident profit motive--Apple at its best.

author: David Pogue
text: Apple will now harness the health data generated phones and watches for medical research. THAT is a big deal.

author: David Pogue
text: So far, Tim Cook (at the live Apple event today) hasn't said anything that couldn't have just been sent in a press release. Just sayin'...

author: David Pogue
text: Tim Cook is wrapping up the event. The black button-down shirt can go back to the closet for another few months. Thanks, all, for tuning in!

author: David Pogue
text: New Mac Mini today, too. $100 less (now $500), updated components. Cool-lookin’ little box.

author: David Pogue
text: The iMac Retina screen will be $2500. Apple says that's cheaper than a 4K screen ONLY--and you get a free computer.

author: David Pogue
text: So they've now brought Retina screens to the phone, the tablet, the MacBook Pro, and the iMac. WHY NOT THE MACBOOK AIR!?

author: David Pogue
text: The new iMac has "organic passivation." I had a girlfriend with that once.

author: David Pogue
text: 7X more pixels on iMac's screen than on an HD TV. And 67% more than a 4K TV. And if there's a dead pixel, I bet you can't even see it.

author: David Pogue
text: How sharp is the iMac's Retina screen? They just zoomed into a guy on its screen photo--you could practically count the guy's nose hairs.

author: David Pogue
text: Next announcement: the Retina-screen iMac!

author: David Pogue
text: Jeez. The Mac's sales have gone up 18% in the last year. I can remember people saying that Apple would CANCEL the Mac a couple years ago!

author: David Pogue
text: Thank you, Twitter followers--he DID say the iPad Mini 3 has the fingerprint reader and other improvements!

author: David Pogue
text: All these new iPads are shipping at the end of next week. Lots of Fedex under-door-slipping.

author: David Pogue
text: New iPad Mini 3, too. He just breezed passed it--didn't say if it has all the new stuff, like the fingerprint scanner.

author: David Pogue
text: The 64- and 128-gigabyte iPad Air 2 models are $100 less than before ($600 and $700).

author: David Pogue
text: Oops--I'm embarrassed--you can ALREADY get the iPad in a 128gb version. Sorry. Not enough sleep.

author: David Pogue
text: You heard it hear first (because Apple hasn't said it): the iPad Air 2 will be available in a 128-gigabyte version. Let's see if I'm right.

author: David Pogue
text: Demo of Pixelmator for iPad. He used it to erase an oryx from a photo of the desert. I didn't even know what an oryx was--and now it's gone!

author: David Pogue
text: The iPad Air 2 has a fingerprint sensor like the iPhone's! Who saw THAT coming? (Oh wait--I did!)

author: David Pogue
text: The iPad Air 2 gains time-lapse video like iPhone 6. Still can't figure out how MUCH it speeds up the video--seems to vary by video length.

author: David Pogue
text: RT @Zoyx: @Pogue "The best camera is the one you have at the moment" - Some guy rationalizing taking pictures with his tablet.

author: David Pogue
text: The camera in the iPad Air 2 is improved. Still unimproved: how idiotic you look taking pictures with a tablet.

author: David Pogue
text: How long before the first people start complaining that the iPad Air 2 bends when they sit down with it in their pockets?

author: David Pogue
text: iPad Air 2: Its A8X chip is 40% faster. it has 3 billion transistors. I'd hate to be the guy who has to count them.

author: David Pogue
text: There's a new anti-reflective coating on the iPad Air 2 screen. Does that mean I can't use it to check my hair anymore?

author: David Pogue
text: iPad Air, at 6.1 mm, is "thinnest tablet in the world." 2 of them stacked: still thinner than original iPad. Also, you can roll it up.

author: David Pogue
text: The iPad Air 2 is very thin. When Fedex delivers it, they just slip it under your door.

author: David Pogue
text: Looks like the big news about the iPad Air 2 is that it's ... THINNER.

author: David Pogue
text: In the 12 months, Apple sold more iPads alone than the TOTAL # of computers sold by Lenovo, HP, Dell, or Acer. Yeow.

author: David Pogue
text: iOS 8.1 will be a free download on Monday. You'll be able to start Apple Paying on the spot!

author: David Pogue
text: Yosemite is a free download TODAY. And my review will be posted on http://t.co/QTofS1dTlf at noon PT!

author: David Pogue
text: I have to say, that thing about using the Mac as a speakerphone is the bomb. I've been using it. Super handy.

author: David Pogue
text: Apple says that Safari can play Netflix streaming 3 hours longer than other browsers. Did Netflix pay Apple for THAT special access, too?

author: David Pogue
text: Apple offered a public beta of OS X Yosemite. Over a million people pounding on it. Let's hope it's bug-free, then!

author: David Pogue

text: My first writing job was Macworld magazine; 13 wonderful years. Today, nearly the entire staff has been laid off. Breaks my heart.

author: David Pogue
text: Argh. Sorry about last tweet. Apple Watch is OK for RAIN and washing hands—NOT for showering or swimming.

author: David Pogue
text: Now we know what's in the huge white temporary building next door: iPhones and iWatches to play with!

author: David Pogue
text: It’s strongly looking like the Apple Watch is not waterproof. That’s a biggggggg problem.

author: David Pogue
text: Apple is giving U2’s new album away, free, to EVERYONE. It’s already in your iTunes library, they say.

author: David Pogue
text: I love U2, but today at the Apple event, they were performing as U2Loud.

author: David Pogue
text: OK, that's it for the Apple announcements. We have stories ALREADY on http://t.co/EovLH0f9U6 on each news bit; more shortly. See you there!

author: David Pogue
text: So the iWatch has FOUR ways to input: Speak, touch the screen, turn the crown, press the button under the crown. Brainwaves coming in 2.0.

author: David Pogue
text: OHO! "One more ONE MORE thing"--you'll be able to use Apple Pay with Apple Watch! Pay for stuff by waving your hand.

author: David Pogue
text: On Twitter, @maughmer says: "The Onion has already reported that the Apple Watch allows users to start and stop the flow of time."

author: David Pogue
text: RT @maughmer: @Pogue The Onion has already reported that it allows users to start and stop the flow of time.

author: David Pogue
text: Apple Watch will be $350. When it comes out…NEXT YEAR.

author: David Pogue
text: LOVE this magnetic charger. Just clinks onto the back of the watch. I'd like that for my phone, camera, and MiFi, please.

author: David Pogue
text: Yes, the iWatch REQUIRES the iPhone. Probably no surprise there. (iPhone 5 or later.)

author: David Pogue
text: Apple Watch controls your Apple TV, serves as a remote control for your iPhone camera, works as walkie-talkie, cleans your gutters!

author: David Pogue
text: "Why would you use a smartwatch instead of your phone?" Health tracking is one key reason. The iWatch seems to be a tracking superstar.

author: David Pogue
text: The Apple Watch prods you to move more, stand more, and eat more oatmeal. (OK, not that last one.)

author: David Pogue
text: All the new stuff today is "Apple Pay," "Apple Watch," etc. Wonder if the era of the i-Name is over?

author: David Pogue
text: (Join @YahooTech here now--http://t.co/qswmFFcajU --for the finale of our live Apple blog. Much more info than I can type by myself!)

author: David Pogue
text: I can't type fast enough to show all the stuff they're showing. But this is by FAR the richest, deepest, most elaborate smartwatch OS ever.

author: David Pogue
text: At Starwood hotels, you can unlock your hotel room by waving the iWatch. I WAS ALIVE TO SEE THE DAY!

author: David Pogue
text: And yes, you can tweet from the iWatch. Two taps, and then speak.

author: David Pogue
text: (Correction to my earlier post: The watch doesn't have its own GPS. Uses the iPhone's location info.)

author: David Pogue
text: From Twitter: "How much memory?" "Waterproof?" "Battery life?" "Price?" "Release date?" Apple hasn't said yet.

author: David Pogue
text: O, M, G. You can draw messages to each other. Ain't NOBODY done this before, at least on a watch, at leas not like this.

author: David Pogue
text: Apple Watch does GPS and navigation, of course. Question: Will smartwatches lead to MORE or FEWER accidents?

author: David Pogue
text: All your photos on the Apple Watch's 1-inch screen! Wonder if it comes with reading glasses?

author: David Pogue
text: OK, Apple fanboys and Fandroids: Let's meet at midnight in the school auditorium and have it out once and for all.

author: David Pogue
text: The watch takes dictation! "Apple Watch, take a memo..."

author: David Pogue
text: On Twitter, @asg749d: "Does the iWatch require an iPhone?" They haven't said, but does WORK with iPhone (notifications, music control, etc.)

author: David Pogue
text: Apple introduces a new user-interface term: "force-touching." Because the watch differentiates between tapping lightly and pressing hard.

author: David Pogue
text: The Home screen on the watch is dozens of UNLABELED tiny round icons. Hmm.

author: David Pogue
text: Choice of iWatch sizes, band sizes, watch materials, band materials. Big difference from the Jobs era, where you got what Apple gave you.

author: David Pogue
text: Seriously: this is the FIRST Apple Watch. Think about the evolution of iPhone. Can you imagine how thin and stunning this will be in 2019?!

author: David Pogue
text: Apple Watch will be available in 18K gold, for those in the Tesla crowd.

author: David Pogue
text: Apple is showing these amazing watchbands, including magnetic-closing ones. Forget the watch--how can I get those BANDS?

author: David Pogue
text: Oh thank god. It doesn't require a Philips screwdriver and 2 hours to change watchbands. Just slides right out.

author: David Pogue
text: Nobody's yet seen the Apple Watch in person. Could the screen possibly look as amazing as it does in this video?

author: David Pogue
text: The back of the watch has 2 lenses: IR, light (for pulse rate); magnetic wireless charger snaps on. It, too, is gorgeous.

author: David Pogue
text: OK, the watch DOES have a touchscreen--in fact, it knows how HARD you're pressing. TOLD you it was mindreading.

author: David Pogue
text: Amazing watch interface. All those "Apple doesn't innovate anymore" whiners (like me) will have to shut up for awhile.

author: David Pogue
text: Jony Ive, Apple designer, now narrating a video about the watch. How come he's never onstage live? Doesn't he want to feel like a rockstar?

author: David Pogue
text: Wild... You control the Apple Watch with a clickable crown on the side. So far, no indication that it's a touchscreen, though.

author: David Pogue
text: The watch is absolutely beautiful--they're CRYING over at Pebble--but it's kinda thick and chunky.

author: David Pogue
text: iPod had click wheel. iPhone had touchscreen. What about the watch? Say brainwaves! Say brainwaves!

author: David Pogue
text: The problem with smartwatches has always been WHY? One answer: As a health/fitness monitor. Apple is playing that one right with the iWatch.

author: David Pogue
text: The Apple Watch is wirelessly accurate to within +/- 50 milliseconds. Maybe meetings will start on time now, for god's sake.

author: David Pogue
text: Oh, sorry--they're calling it the Apple Watch, not the iWatch.

author: David Pogue
text: The iWatch is shiny metal; swappable bands. Choice of finishes. Sapphire crystal. The question is--how easily does drool wipe off of it?

author: David Pogue
text: The watch is GORGEOUS... especially in closeup, almost pornographic slow-motion!

author: David Pogue
text: VIDEO... .meet the iWatch!!!! And YOU WERE ALIVE TO SEE IT!

author: David Pogue
text: It's the iWatch. Here it comes!!! Hold your breath! Turn off your ringer! Exit the bathroom!

author: David Pogue
text: "One more thing".... and 2000 journalists' pupils dilate!

author: David Pogue
text: I’ve been live-blogging Apple’s iPhone 6 and payment systems here: http://t.co/ItO5ON0g8l  Tune in now if you want to hear about the iWatch!

author: David Pogue
text: If anyone has a chance to make wireless payments a Thing, it's Apple. It's persuading stores AND online companies to accept ApplePay.

author: David Pogue
text: But this business of paying with your phone won't be real magic until it works everywhere (not just the 200K stores with receivers).

author: David Pogue
text: The security system for Apple Pay is your fingerprint. (The card # is not stored in the phone.) Just don't let anyone amputate your finger.

author: David Pogue
text: To pay with ApplePay, you just hold iPhone 6 to the special terminal--simpler than Android Wallet. But the store does need the terminal.

author: David Pogue
text: Yes, you'll now be able to pay for stuff using your iPhone. The over-40 set is horrified. "What if I lose my phone!?"

author: David Pogue
text: Tim Cook is now about to reveal how you'll pay for stuff with the phone. How will Apple's system be any more successful than Google's?

author: David Pogue
text: They showed two ads narrated by Jimmy Fallon and Justin Timberlake. Dang. I bet they got free iPhone 6's out of that deal.

author: David Pogue
text: iOS 8 will be free to download on 9/18, with the new iPhones on 9/19.

author: David Pogue
text: Lines are forming already at Apple stores in big cities...

author: David Pogue
text: $200 (16gb), $300 (64gb storage), and $400 (128gb) for the new, bigger iPhone 6 (with contract). Add $100 for the jumbo Plus model.

author: David Pogue
text: 128gb of storage built in? Maybe we can now stop whining that there's no removable memory card...

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 6 prices: $200 (16gb), $300 (64gb storage), and $400 (128gb) for the new, bigger iPhone 6 (with contract).

author: David Pogue
text: The unsung new feature of the iPhone 6's rounded design: You'll be able to tell the front from the back, in your pocket, for the first ti...

author: David Pogue
text: (On Twitter, you're all asking why the iPhone has a barometer for altitude measuring. It's because it detects air pressure.)

author: David Pogue
text: 240 frames per second on the iPhone 6 camera! My god. With that degree of slo-mo, you could capture a teenager smiling at the camera.

author: David Pogue
text: OK, Apple just showed a nighttime photo. I withdraw my snarky remark about bright light.

author: David Pogue
text: The new iPhone *6* has a BAROMETER, for measuring altitude (like going up stairs). (Details on my live blog: http://t.co/ItO5ON0g8l )

author: David Pogue
text: Oops, sorry—iPhone 6. I’m typing fast.

author: David Pogue

author: David Pogue
text: To be clear: the iPhone’s fingerprint reader is an OPTIONAL security feature. And your fingerprint is not sent or stored online.

author: David Pogue
text: You guys crack me up. You’re all freaked out, calling the iPhone 5S fingerprint sensor a security HOLE!? How’s it any worse than a password?

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 5S and 5C release date: Sept. 20. Prices for 5S are the same as always: $200, $300, $400 (16, 32, 64 gigs).

author: David Pogue
text: To wake the iPhone 5S, you just touch the Home button; it scans your fingerprint. Also works to make iTunes purchases instead of a password.

author: David Pogue
text: As rumored: the iPhone 5S’s Home button is a fingerprint reader. Apple calls it Touch ID. You can teach it different fingers. Any angle.

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 5S also has 10 frames-per-second burst mode, and 120 frames-per-second slow motion video.

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 5S has TWO flashes: white+amber. Together, they adjust the color tone of the flash to match the scene. World’s first, Apple says.

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 5S has new camera: new f2.2 lens, 15% larger sensor, BIGGER pixels (yay!).

author: David Pogue
text: iPhone 5S has a new “motion coprocessor” chip for real-time processing of accelerometer, gyro, and compass data, for better fitness apps.

author: David Pogue
text: And now, the new iPhone 5S: in black, gray, or gold. New A7 chip—first 64-bit chip in a phone, Apple says.

author: David Pogue
text: (yes, I meant “you’re being a bad influency.” Damned autocorrect!)
